block.p: COLUMBIA ENERGY GROUP, Herndon, Va., the energy services company, said it is seeking to sell its Propane Corp., Richmond, Va., and Petroleum Corp., Richland, Pa., subsidiaries.

GN STORE NORD, Copenhagen, the Danish telecommunications and electronic equipment company, said it agreed to buy privately held Jabra Corp., San Diego, for $40 million, plus extra payments of up to $35 million depending on Jabra's future earnings.
COLUMBIA ENERGY GROUP, Herndon, Va., the energy services company, said it is seeking to sell its Propane Corp., Richmond, Va., and Petroleum Corp., Richland, Pa., subsidiaries.

GN STORE NORD, Copenhagen, the Danish telecommunications and electronic equipment company, said it agreed to buy privately held Jabra Corp., San Diego, for $40 million, plus extra payments of up to $35 million depending on Jabra's future earnings.

RADIO ONE INC., Lanham, Md., the urban broadcaster that owns and operates 50 radio stations aimed at the African-American market, said it would split its stock 3-for-1. The split will be in the form of a stock dividend of two newly created shares for each of the 28.3 million shares outstanding.

CROMPTON CORP., Greenwich, Conn., said it is in talks with unspecified buyers to sell an industrial-chemicals unit as part of the company's plan to focus on its main polymer and specialty-chemical businesses.
